text: my seven-year-old loves frozen fish
sticks I like to make meals that we can
all enjoy and frozen fish sticks is not
one of them so instead I bake up some
fish and chips it's easy it's tasty it's
adult friendly and it doesn't stink up
my kitchen so you want to have skinny
potatoes for a maximum surface area and
then I like to leave the skin on because
I like that extra flavor and it also
makes it a little more crisp and then
add lots of oil here and nicely seasoned
with salt and pepper
get your baking pan nice and hot before
you put the potatoes in because as soon
as they make contact with that hot pan
they're gonna start sizzling and
browning immediately and it's gonna get
them extra crunchy and then I'm gonna
put them in a minute I have some bread
crumbs here that I'm gonna use to coat
the fish and I mixed in some garlic some
thyme some black pepper just to give it
extra seasoning the breadcrumbs won't
take on enough color and they won't get
that really toasty flavor unless they do
it on the stove and it just takes a
couple of minutes so I've got my bread
crumbs and then just to give it a little
extra flavor I am going to add some
mustard to the egg mixture mustard just
adds tartness sharpness so when you're
making fish and chips you always want to
look for a mild white flaky fish that's
a little bit thick and in this case I
have cod but try to find something
sustainable for your area and then you
want to coat it so you use one hand for
the dry ingredients so this is gonna be
my dry hand plop this into the wet and
then I have my other hand which deals
with the wet ingredients
so the reason that I'm putting the fish
on a rack on top of a baking sheet
instead of directly on the baking sheet
is that they're going to be more crisp
that way otherwise the bottom side is
going to be soggy you can buy tartar
sauce to serve the fish and chips with
but I would say it's worth investing in
extra five minutes in making your own
you can even use jarred Mayo but by
adding fresh capers and fresh herbs and
freshly grated lemon zest you're gonna
have so much more complexity and flavor
you definitely want to make the homemade
tartar sauce if you're serving this to
adults but if you're serving this to
kids ketchup is allowed
